SENT.plain: Resection of a false aneurysm of the aortic arch in a patient with BehÃ§et's disease was safely performed using an "aortic no-touch" technique

This consisted of: (1) femoral artery and bicaval cannulation, (2) profound hypothermia (below 20 degrees C) by core cooling, (3) retrograde cardioplegia through the coronary sinus, and (4) total body retrograde perfusion via both venae cavae without aortic cross-clamping
The patient showed no evidence of neurological damage and the postoperative course was uneventful
